    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"

>
[Shorthanded](/Feats.aspx?ID=3224) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 129</row>

**Archetype** [Artillerist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=115)

</column>

---

Typically, a [siege weapon](/equipment/siege-weapons) is meant to be run by a crew with a very specific minimum number of members designed to ensure that your crew can account for every possible variable and necessity in loading, aiming, and firing the weapon. In a pinch, however, you can operate it with fewer people, provided you know what you're doing. You can operate a siege weapon with fewer than the minimum number of crew, at an increasing penalty. You and your crew take a –2 penalty to checks to [Load](/Rules.aspx?ID=1624), [Aim](/Rules.aspx?ID=1625), [Launch](/Rules.aspx?ID=1626), move, or [Repair](/Actions.aspx?ID=42) the weapon for each person below the minimum crew. The maximum number of missing minimum crew members you can handle with this feat is 5. For example, if a siege weapon had a minimum crew size of 8, you would still need a crew of 3, and you would take a –10 penalty when doing so.
